title: This cup is a lifesaver.
review: Excellent produce!My mother (87 yrs old) is in a nursing home, under Hospice care, with throat cancer.  She is able to drink her meals, with this cup.

title: Nice concept, but lacking in function
review: It works as long as you have a good sized coffee container and it is reasonably full.  Deep in a small or container or where it is near the bottom controlling the amount of coffee you scoop is difficult.

title: Safe
review: Excellent for dementia individuals who have choking issues and need thickened beverages, no straw required, which is good, straws promote aspiration of liquids into lungs.

title: Ease of handling, drink from.
review: Purchased for Alzheimer‚Äôs patient with difficulty holding items. The ridges make it easier and the ‚Äúsippy‚Äù spout keeps her from getting too much liquids at once with her difficulty swallowing, possibly choking.

title: Not as advertised
review: Would love to give this no stars!NOT LEAK PROOF!!!! Not even close! Liquids pour out it easily, just having it on its side liquids drain out, beyond disappointment

title: Great for elderly folks who still want to feed themselves!
review: This cup really allows my elderly mom to feed herself soup.  It is sturdy and seems to tolerate the microwave and dishwasher just fine.

title: Easy to handle
review: It is leak proof, thick, and easy to clean.

title: Works greT
review: Just what we needed for family member in hospital bed

title: This cup is not worth the money
review: It is not by no means leak proof in any way. Not happy with these cups at all

title: Leaks
review: Would not stay sealed

title: Child-sized
review: I was looking for a cup for an adult stroke patient and this looked ideal.  It is actually a child-sized cup, and I should have realized when I read who many ounces it holds.  Totally my fault that I didn't read the description more closely.  Still usable, I just have to refill more often. Other than that, it's great!

title: Great cup for advanced special needs users, straw drinkers and good hand/head control.
review: I would work great for special needs person with good hand mouth control.  Handle not secured made the ‚Äúremovable‚Äù but we needed it to be right/glued.  Moth spout was to long and kept hitting her teeth.  Great cup for more advanced users of special needs. Just wasn‚Äôt what we needed.

title: Not for elderly
review: Not anything like I thought... way too small for an adult. If used by elderly they have hold their head back.  Hard to hold.  Saw photos of a man drinking and looked bigger.  Very disappointed

title: Terrible
review: My mother in law is blind so we bought this for her. It's terrible! Leaks, spills. I've never received anything that I did not like from Amazon, but this was not a good purchase. We will throw it out.

title: Handling for elderly
review: Poor. Cheap quality

title: Not worth it.
review: Not leak proof. Tip over and it will still spill. We actually put a straw in it 4 my dad since too much drink comes out when he tips cup 2 drink.  Only plus is I can usually catch him b4 all of his drink ends up on the furniture.

title: Not spill proof
review: It‚Äôs not spill proof

title: Disappointed
review: Product is fairly made. Handle unstable. Seal under lid falls out constantly when screwing on lid. Absolutely not spill/leak proof. I have to handle for my patients. Not as perceived for medical adaptive equipment. Entirely to costly for the poor quality of product.

title: worthless....
review: worthless...

title: Not at all leak or spill proof
review: Neither of the 2 lids prevent any kind of spill. Liquid will come out easily. The handle is so loose it promotes spilling.

title: Look for better product
review: Very small Cup and very thin material. Slip on handle is unstable. Not safe for a child and to small for audit use.

title: Is not leak proof.
review: Small cup is easy to fill. Is NOT spill proof or spill resistant.

title: Not big enough
review: Not big enough

title: Too small
review: This cup is not spill proof. Disappointed

title: Dislike
review: The cup is very sharp at the top .. I washed it twice and both times I cut the top of my hand. The handle moves a lot doesn‚Äôt have a good grip on the cup itself

title: Ok Cup
review: This cup was smaller than I expected and the handle can move up & down slightly which made my 92-year old friend a little nervous when she first used it-so we secured it with a rubber band underneath the handle to stop the slipping. She also couldn‚Äôt tip the cup to her mouth to drink out of it so we now use straws in the spout and she likes that.

title: Not as describdd
review: Thus does not control flow at all. Can't be used.

review: Disappointed in themCheap, no insulationPoor seal qualityLook like dollar storecupsThe only good feature is the long spout

title: Works good
review: This cup has been very helpful for my Father in law who has Parkeninsons and is in hospice it is easy to use and lightweight, an somewhat spillproof.

title: Works  well
review: Got this f or someone  who has trouble  holding  things.  Works  well. They  love  it.
